headline: Business and People Focused | Systems Thinker | Specializing in Employee Relations, Workforce Planning, Conflict Resolution, and Leadership Development
summary:
I’ve made it my mission to go beyond conventional HR solutions. With a Bachelor’s in Business Administration and a Master’s in Employment Relations from Memorial University of Newfoundland, I bring over 20 years of experience in Human Resources, leadership and workforce planning. I have built a progressive leadership career in Human Resources, where I have honed my skills in developing effective teams and driving organizational success. My training and career has equipped me with a deep understanding of the complex relationship between business needs and people strategy. I’ve delved deeply into pretty well all facets of HR, from strategic HR planning and leadership development to employee relations, collective bargaining and talent acquisition among much more.

Throughout my career, I’ve worked across industries such as healthcare, construction, energy, community services, home care and energy—gaining firsthand experience with a wide range of regulated professions and support services. This variety has taught me that no two businesses are alike, and I specialize in helping organizations identify systemic gaps, optimize performance, and create sustainable change.

experiences.title: Human Resources Consultant Lead
experiences.description: In my current role I perform grievance management, collective agreement interpretation, workplace investigations, disability management, among various other areas of labor relations and human resources. I provide a comprehensive human resources and labor relations service to the management team and employees of Eastern Health.

experiences.title: Human Resources Coordinator
experiences.description: I started my career with this organization doing recruitment and selection for the regulated operations division, Hydro. In 2008 I moved to the Lower Churchill Project and acted in a generalist role. I performed their recruitment and selection, facilitated orientation, developed policies and procedures, supported team building among various other areas relating to human resources.
